name: Hydroxyzine (Vistaril)
summary: An antihistamine with anxiolytic and sedative properties used for anxiety, pruritus, and insomnia.
description: Hydroxyzine is a first-generation antihistamine that blocks histamine H1 receptors. It also has anticholinergic and sedative properties, making it useful in the short-term management of anxiety, allergic conditions, and insomnia. Vistaril is a commonly known brand name for the pamoate salt formulation, often used in psychiatry as a non-habit-forming anxiolytic.

monitoring_required: Cardiac conduction (if at risk for QT prolongation)

sections.text: Blocks histamine H1 receptors in the CNS and periphery; also exhibits anticholinergic and sedative effects.

adult.pruritus: 25 mg three to four times daily

sections.geriatric: Use lower initial doses due to increased sensitivity to sedation
sections.hepatic_impairment: Reduce dose; increased half-life in hepatic dysfunction

sections.text: Onset within 15–30 minutes; duration 4–6 hours (may be longer in elderly).

other: Avoid in first trimester of pregnancy
May cause additive CNS depression with alcohol or sedatives
Caution in elderly due to anticholinergic burden

items: ECG if at risk for QT prolongation

sections.pregnancy: Avoid in early pregnancy; later use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; may cause sedation in infant
sections.pediatrics: Avoid in neonates due to CNS depression risk
sections.geriatrics: Lower doses recommended to reduce sedation and fall risk

sections.text: No physiological dependence expected; abrupt cessation is safe.

items: Useful for patients with anxiety who cannot take benzodiazepines
Can be prescribed as an as-needed anxiolytic
Also marketed as Atarax (hydrochloride salt) in some regions
